definition: secretly/in private/behind someone's back
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
behind sb's back
(bird species of China) plain-backed thrush (Zoothera mollissima)
behind sb's back/privately/on the sly
(bird species of China) ground tit (Pseudopodoces humilis)

sentences.english: The superficial nobody dares to give misdemeanour to you and make in the behind floor Ban son of will be more.
sentences.chinese: 表面上沒人敢得罪你，在背地裏使絆子的會更多。

sentences.english: Lee is a person who would spend money secretly to make people believe he was infinitely capable and influential.
sentences.chinese: 他背地裏花錢，爲要人們相信他神通廣大，有權有勢。

sentences.english: She slandered him behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 她在背地裏對他造謠中傷。

sentences.english: that Phoebus Apollo was actually eavesdropping on the poet's discourse.
sentences.chinese: 關於阿波羅是否在背地裏偷聽詩人的演說。

sentences.english: I can't believe that Carl would bad-mouth me like that.
sentences.chinese: 我簡直不相信卡爾竟是那樣在背地裏說我的壞話呀。

sentences.english: You hear from other people that she's cheating on him.
sentences.chinese: 你從其他人口中得知這女孩背地裏對他不忠。

sentences.english: They talked about so-called democracy all the time, but privately make fucking intrigue.
sentences.chinese: 他們表面講什麼民主政治，背地裏搞他媽的陰謀詭計。

sentences.english: This hypocritical bureaucrat has done many bad things secretly.
sentences.chinese: 這些虛僞的官紳背地裏做盡了壞事。

sentences.english: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
sentences.chinese: 當面的責備，強如背地的愛情。

sentences.english: I'd heard people say behind his back that Kong Yiji had studied.
sentences.chinese: 聽人家背地裏談論，孔乙己原來也讀過書。

sentences.english: He assumed there was a sad story behind every one of them.
sentences.chinese: 他相信，他們每個別背地都有一個悲慘的故事。

definition: behind sb's back
secretly/inwardly/on the sly
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
secretly/inwardly
unpleasant talk/malicious words
sanctimonious/dignified
hypocrite
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
hypocrisy/pretended righteousness
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
lit. a dagger hidden in smiles (idiom); friendly manners belying hypocritical intentions/when the fox preaches, look to the geese
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to work against the interests of sb one derives support from/to double-cross one's employer/to bite the hand that feeds you
